problems.title: Burning Rubber Smell / Brush Stopped
problems.description: Smell of burnt rubber and the green light on the nozzle flickers.
possible_causes: Brush roll height set too low
solution_steps: Use the belt lifter handle to loosen the belt.
Replace the knurled belt. Kirby belts are designed to break to save the motor.

problems.title: Loss of Suction
solution_steps: Replace the disposable bag. Do not reuse.
Check the tube connecting the bag to the unit.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Avalir 2?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $377 vacuum, and extending the life of your Kirby is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Avalir 2 needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Avalir 2 myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
